impact.statement: People around the world experience and enjoy a single, unified Web that works consistently across devices, browsers, and platforms, ensuring users can freely choose the tools they want to interact with the Web.

outcomes.statement: Interoperable Web technologies are deployed seamlessly across the globe.

indicators.description: Differential rate of adoption by content developers of Web technologies across countries (or regions of the globe)
Differential rate of number/time of digital activities done through the Web vs other platforms across the globe

outputs.statement:
Interoperable web technologies: standards, test suites, supporting adoption tooling (e.g. validator, polyfill), reference
implementations
GAP: regular report on barriers to global adoption of Web technologies

outcomes.statement: Interoperable Web technologies are deployed seamlessly across hardware and OS boundaries.

indicators.description: Differential rate of implementation of Web technologies across hardware boundaries (incl form factor, performance profile)
Differential rate of implementation of Web technologies across OS boundaries
Differential rate of adoption of content developers of Web technologies across hardware/OS boundaries
Differential rate of number/time of digital activities done through the Web vs other platform on a given hardware profile
Differential rate of number/time of digital activities done through the Web vs other platform on a given OS

outputs.statement:
Interoperable web technologies: standards, test suites, supporting adoption tooling (e.g. validator, polyfill), reference
implementations
Gap: running test suites across different hardware profile
Gap: systematic review of Web technologies across hardware profiles (e.g. low end devices)

outcomes.statement:
A rich and interoperable ecosystem of Web user agent
provide meaningful choice to end users.

indicators.description: The number of Web technologies that are implemented interoperably across browsers (“baseline newly available”)
The number of content and services on the Web that don’t work well across browsers (proxy: Web Compat?)
The number of Web user agents available on the market
The number of Web rendering engines used to consume Web content

outputs.statement: Baseline definition and tracking (WebDX, not fully W3C endorsed at the moment)
GAP: structural effort on Web engine monoculture risk?
WPT Interop project (not quite a W3C output at the moment though)

outcomes.statement: Interoperable Web technologies provide a credible alternative to proprietary platforms for content and service providers.

indicators.description: Quantity of content and services that don’t provide any Web experience
Quantity of content and services that provide a sub-par Web experience
Differential time spent on proprietary platforms vs Web
Weighted gap of differences of features provided in proprierty platforms vs Web
